intro: Salsola gossypina, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with spiny stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and covered in a powdery coating. Salsola gossypina is adapted to thrive in dry environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
